text: Curtin Springs is a large working cattle station in the Northern Territory of Australia. It is on the Lasseter Highway, east of Yulara. The property is in size. Mount Conner is inside the southern border of the property. Curtin Springs was built in 1943 and is owned and operated by the Severin family. It also includes a roadhouse, an inn and a campground. In September and October 2012, bushfires destroyed over of bush, nearly a quarter of its pasture land. ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:Northern Territory Category:Buildings and structures in Australia Category:Farms Category:Agriculture in Australia Category:1943 establishments Category:1940s establishments in Australia
title: Curtin Springs
